unnormalised: E-commerce is booming in India, guys! Did you know that online transactions increased by, like, 60% this year? It's crazy! Everyone's buying stuff online, from groceries to gadgets. My neighbour, Mrs. Sharma, even ordered a saree online for Diwali, and she usually hates that sort of thing!
normalised: E-commerce is booming in India, guys! Did you know that online transactions increased by, like, sixty percent this year? It's crazy! Everyone's buying stuff online, from groceries to gadgets. My neighbor, Missus Sharma, even ordered a saree online for Diwali, and she usually hates that sort of thing!

unnormalised: According to a recent report by, um, 'India E-Commerce Insights,' the average online transaction value is around Rs. 2500. That's a lot of samosas! And get this - the most popular payment method is still UPI, with over 70% of transactions happening through apps like PhonePe and Paytm. No surprises there, right? So convenient!
normalised: According to a recent report by, um, 'India E-Commerce Insights,' the average online transaction value is around rupee two thousand five hundred. That's a lot of samosas! And get this - the most popular payment method is still U-P-I, with over seventy percent of transactions happening through apps like PhonePe and Paytm. No surprises there, right? So convenient!

unnormalised: Amazon and Flipkart are still the big players, holding about 75% of the market share, but smaller, specialized e-commerce sites are also popping up like mushrooms after the monsoon. I saw this cool website the other day that only sells handmade crafts from artisans in Rajasthan. Everything was listed in rupees "₹".
normalised: Amazon and Flipkart are still the big players, holding about seventy five percent of the market share, but smaller, specialized e-commerce sites are also popping up like mushrooms after the monsoon. I saw this cool website the other day that only sells handmade crafts from artisans in Rajasthan. Everything was listed in rupees "rupee".

unnormalised: The government’s also pushing for more digital payments with initiatives like, you know, 'Digital India,' which has helped a ton. But, of course, there are challenges. Like, logistics in rural areas can be a nightmare. Getting that package from Delhi to a village in, say, Bihar can take ages and cost a fortune - like Rs 500 for some items.
normalised: The government’s also pushing for more digital payments with initiatives like, you know, 'Digital India,' which has helped a ton. But, of course, there are challenges. Like, logistics in rural areas can be a nightmare. Getting that package from Delhi to a village in, say, Bihar can take ages and cost a fortune - like rupee five hundred for some items.

unnormalised: Also, online fraud is a big concern. My cousin got scammed for, oh, I think it was Rs. 5000 while trying to buy a new phone on some shady website. Always double-check the seller's reviews and make sure the website has that little padlock icon in the address bar!
normalised: Also, online fraud is a big concern. My cousin got scammed for, oh, I think it was rupee five thousand while trying to buy a new phone on some shady website. Always double-check the seller's reviews and make sure the website has that little padlock icon in the address bar!

unnormalised: And then there's the whole thing about returns. It's such a hassle sometimes! You order a kurta online, it arrives, doesn't fit, and then you have to spend, like, a week fighting with the customer service to get your Rs 1000 back. Happened to me once. Never again!
normalised: And then there's the whole thing about returns. It's such a hassle sometimes! You order a kurta online, it arrives, doesn't fit, and then you have to spend, like, a week fighting with the customer service to get your rupee one thousand back. Happened to me once. Never again!

unnormalised: So, yeah, e-commerce in India is a wild ride. It's convenient, it's growing like crazy, but you gotta be smart and careful out there. Happy shopping, everyone! Just remember, do your research, be aware of the risks, and maybe avoid buying anything too expensive from websites you've never heard of!
normalised: So, yeah, e-commerce in India is a wild ride. It's convenient, it's growing like crazy, but you gotta be smart and careful out there. Happy shopping, everyone! Just remember, do your research, be aware of the risks, and maybe avoid buying anything too expensive from websites you've never heard of!

unnormalised: It's fascinating how much the industry is expected to grow, predictions put it at $350 billion USD by 2030.
normalised: It's fascinating how much the industry is expected to grow, predictions put it at dollar three hundred and fifty billion U-S-D by two thousand and thirty.
